Label: Glucose-6-phosphate
Comment: search for glucose 6-phosphate</br>Type your comment here

Label: GYS1
Comment: catalyzes the rate-limiting step in glycogen synthesis in the liver and in skeletal muscle: the transfer of glucose monomers from UDP-glucose to the terminal branch of the growing glycogen chain via the formation of α(1→4) glycosidic bonds</br>GYS1: specific to skeletal muscle

Label: GBE1
Comment: glycogen branching enzyme that catalyzes the transfer of alpha-1,4-linked glucosyl units from the outer end of a glycogen chain to an alpha-1,6 position on the same or a neighboring glycogen chain

Label: GYG2
Comment: expressed mainly in liver, cardiac muscle and other types of tissue, but not in skeletal muscle.

Label: GYG1
Comment: Glycogenin-1 is involved in the biosynthesis of glycogen. It is capable of self-glucosylation, forming an oligosaccharide primer that serves as a substrate for glycogen synthase. It also plays a role in glycogen metabolism regulation</br>expressed mostly in muscles

Label: galactose dehydrogenase
Comment: 'This enzyme is part of the De Ley-Doudoroff pathway, which is used by some bacteria during growth on D-galactose.' Source: [https://enzyme.expasy.org/EC/1.1.1.48]
